page.title: 02Farming - General
page.content: Our area is not flat and does not lend itself to arable farming.{Farming {is mixed,}dairy cows,sheep and some arable. Dairy herds of{Fresians }are milked twice a day. The milk being collected daily by bulk tanker and transported to the dairy. Farms in our area no longer bottle and sell their own milk. Farms with no dairy herd, buy in beef calves and fatten for market later. Sheep are of the hardier breeds such as{Mashams.}Lambing is from middle to late spring, the lambs being sold September/October time, known locally as the "back end". Hay,silage and straw are all produced to provide winter fodder,this aspect of farming being completely mechanised.
